thread.title: Coronation Street star Brooke Vincent reveals how she REALLY feels about Helen Flanagan's return
thread.title_full: Coronation Street star Brooke Vincent reveals how she REALLY feels about Helen Flanagan's return

author: Nicola Agius
title: Coronation Street star Brooke Vincent reveals how she REALLY feels about Helen Flanagan's return
text:
Coronation Street star Brooke Vincent reveals how she REALLY feels about Helen Flanagan's return The actresses play on-screen sisters Sophie and Rosie Webster Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Rosie Is Arrested for Drug Smuggling in Coronation Street Share this video Get soaps   Could   
Brooke Vincent and Helen Flanagan were reunited on-screen this week. 
The pair, who play on-screen sisters Sophie and Rosie Webster in Coronation Street, haven't worked together since 2012. 
However, Helen made her highly-anticipated return to the cobbles on Monday - and Brooke couldn't be happier. 
"She's like my big sister," she admitted. "We grew up together and I missed her, so it's great to have her back. The chemistry between us is still there." Brooke Vincent and Helen Flanagan were reunited on-screen this week (Photo: WENN) 
Meanwhile, Brooke recently took a three-month break to go on tour with the play Be My Baby but she is excited about being back on the soap. 
She told the Daily Mail's Weekend magazine: "I've done the same job since I was 11, so this strange environment feels normal to me. When the opportunity came up to go on tour with the play 'Be My Baby', which is set in the 60s, I thought it would be nice to do that, but also have the security to come back here. Helen made her highly-anticipated return to the cobbles on Monday (Photo: ITV) 
"I really enjoyed doing theatre. You have to really concentrate â€“unlike in 'Corrie' there's no opportunity for a second take if you mess up. I learned a lot. I've come back with a different mindset and it made me want to better my character here. Read More 'How does Shona know Kylie Platt?' Coronation Street viewers confused as she visits murdered character's grave The Websters are back together after a four year stint apart (Photo: ITV) 
"I loved doing something different. This is an amazing job but I might be like a Peter Barlow and just try and dip in and out as and when." 
However, she admitted she sometimes gets frustrated with her storylines in Coronation Street. Brooke is delighted Helen is back (Photo: Rex Features) 
She said: "I sometimes feel frustrated when they try to put Sophie with every other girl who's lesbian. There's more to people than their sexuality so I'd prefer to do a storyline about my job or family. Thankfully our producer Kate Oates seems to get that." 
*Coronation Street returns to ITV on Monday at 7.30pm Like us on Facebook
